item.description:
So you want to be an archaeologist?  Get your hands dirty with the DCR archaeologist! Come to Myles Standish State Forest on Saturday, October 29th from 10:00am to 4:00pm for a brief introduction to the science of archaeology. Enjoy a day of digging, washing, recording, mapping, cataloguing and much more.  Stop by for an hour or spend the day with us; feel free to bring lunch as picnic tables will be available nearby.  Bring water and work-gloves.  Meet at the amphitheater behind the headquarters building at 194 Cranberry Road in South Carver. Rain date: Sunday, October 30th. All ages welcome. 

Call (508) 866-2580 x161 for more information.  This free program is sponsored by the Massachusetts Department of Conservation & Recreation.  For park info & directions, visit the DCR web page for Myles Standish State Forest 

For other archaeological events during the month, visit the Mass Archaeology Month Calendar of Events.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Archaeology Day at Myles Standish State Forest- Date Changed to Sunday
